skill.name: langgraph-docs
skill.description: Use this skill for requests related to LangGraph in order to fetch relevant documentation to provide accurate, up-to-date guidance.
skill.summary: Use this skill for requests related to LangGraph in order to fetch relevant documentation to provide...
skill.author: langchain-ai

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based documentation lookup skill with no executable code. All detected findings are false positives: hash algorithm names appear only in metadata fields (not actual crypto operations), C2 keywords like 'fetch' are legitimate documentation retrieval operations, and hardcoded URLs point to official LangChain documentation sources.

content.value_statement: Finding accurate LangGraph documentation requires navigating multiple pages and filtering through extensive content. This skill automatically fetches the documentation index, identifies the most relevant guides for your question, and retrieves the specific content you need.
actual_capabilities: Fetches the official LangGraph documentation index from docs.langchain.com
Selects 2-4 most relevant documentation URLs based on user questions
Retrieves specific documentation pages including how-to guides and tutorials
Provides accurate, up-to-date guidance using official documentation sources
limitations: Does not execute code or run examples
Only accesses official LangChain documentation, not third-party resources
Cannot answer questions outside the scope of LangGraph documentation

use_cases.title: Implementation Guidance
use_cases.description: Get step-by-step instructions for building agent workflows with LangGraph

use_cases.title: API Reference Lookup
use_cases.description: Find detailed API documentation and parameter specifications quickly

use_cases.title: Conceptual Understanding
use_cases.description: Learn core LangGraph concepts through official tutorials and guides

prompt_templates.title: Basic API Question
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I use the StateGraph class in LangGraph to create a workflow?

prompt_templates.title: Implementation Guide
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the steps to implement human-in-the-loop approval in a LangGraph agent?

prompt_templates.title: Architecture Question
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how checkpointing works in LangGraph and when to use it

prompt_templates.title: Troubleshooting
prompt_templates.prompt: My LangGraph agent is getting stuck in a loop. What patterns can prevent this?

output_examples.input: How do I create a simple LangGraph workflow with two nodes?
output: Create a StateGraph with a state schema (dict, TypedDict, or Pydantic model)
Add nodes using graph.add_node(name, callable) where callable is your function or reducer
Optionally add edges to define the flow between nodes
Compile the graph with graph.compile() to create the runnable

output_examples.input: What are the key components of a LangGraph agent?
output: StateGraph defines the agent state structure and updates
Nodes represent discrete steps or actions in the workflow
Edges control the flow between nodes (conditional and unconditional)
Reducers specify how state updates are applied
Checkpoints save state at each step for persistence and debugging

best_practices: Ask specific questions about features or APIs to get the most relevant documentation
Include context about your use case for better results (agent type, integration requirements)
Use this skill before writing code to verify implementation patterns against official docs
anti_patterns: Asking general questions about AI concepts unrelated to LangGraph
Expecting code execution or debugging of your local environment
Relying solely on this skill without reviewing the full documentation for complex implementations

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Check your tool's documentation for installation.

faq.question: What documentation sources are accessed?
faq.answer: Only official LangChain documentation at docs.langchain.com is accessed. No third-party resources.

faq.question: How many documentation pages are retrieved?
faq.answer: The skill fetches the documentation index first, then selects 2-4 of the most relevant pages.

faq.question: Is my data sent to external servers?
faq.answer: Only your question is sent to docs.langchain.com to retrieve documentation. No personal data is transmitted.

faq.question: Why are some answers incomplete?
faq.answer: The skill retrieves documentation but does not execute code. Complex implementations may require full docs review.

faq.question: How does this differ from web search?
faq.answer: This skill accesses the official documentation index directly, ensuring accurate information from the source.
